parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make sufficient, render fit, qualify. From hikanos; to enable, i.e. Qualify.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.
Fresh, new, unused, novel. Of uncertain affinity; new
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From grapho; a writing, i.e. A letter, note, epistle, book, etc. plural learning.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From grapho; a writing, i.e. A letter, note, epistle, book, etc. plural learning.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make that which was dead to live, cause to live, quicken. From the same as zoon and poieo; tovitalize.
